The common name of the medicinal plant Myrtus communis is “myrtle”. It is a species of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is an evergreen bush found in North Africa, western Asia, southern Europe, the Indian subcontinent, and Macaronesia.
9 The essential oil of myrtle may be helpful for the therapy of skin diseases resulting from microorganisms.
5 Few studies have focused on the antimicrobial ability of the essential oils of myrtle against pathogenic fungal and bacterial strains.
